intro: Valerianella eriocarpa var. truncata, commonly known as the woolly valerian or truncate valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, rounded leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in the summer months. Valerianella eriocarpa var. truncata is often found in meadows and along the edges of woodlands.
